Posts.Content: becky1970 wrote: I have read my u-s results a hundred times and I still don't know what Bi-Rads 4.  Could someone tell me what that means?  Also it says I have ill-defined areas of increased density.  Now this worries me a little because when I was diagnosed with brain cancer they used density ALOT with my MRI's.  Any information would be great.  I have my biopsy on the 19th and I am just so freaking worried.  I have stayed calm, but now that it is closer...I am on the verge of losing my mind.  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Nov 2, 2008 10:40AM becky1970 wrote: Thank you Susan.  I know it sounds a little CRAZY to be scared about the pain.  I'm a little nervous about everything else also, but I have a great feeling it will come back B9.  If not I got through brain cancer and I will get through this to.  The hardest is waiting.  I am just so anxious and want this done and over with so I can move on.  I am totally obsessed right now...I think I have read the report over a dozen times.  I'm looking up every word to see exactly what it could mean.  It is literally driving me crazy.....I am really glad I found this site.  It is very encouraging to read all the brave women's story.  I feel like a whiner since I don't even have any bad results yet.

Posts.Content: becky1970 wrote: I have a palpable lump on my left breast.  I had my first mamogram today followed by an ultrasound.  The very nice lady that did my ultrasound said I had ALOT OF CYSTS.  She did not say anything else besides that.  When I was done she told me to wait a minute to see if this was enough for the DR.  She came back and said it was and that I will have results in about a week.  Should I be worried about a lot of cysts and especially the one that I can feel and even started to show.  I was diagnosed with brain cancer in 2003, got through that and have been cancer free for 4 years now.  I am getting a little worried though......Am I just being a little paranoid.  I have had really bad left arm pain for the last few months. Is that a sign of anything?  I was told I probaly have tennis elbow, but it just seems to be getting worse.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Should I be worried? becky1970 becky1970

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2008 04:33PM becky1970 wrote: Well I am having my biopsy in the morning.  The hospital called me to let me know that I don't need to eat or drink anything after midnight.  I am now in freak mode.  I just wish I knew...this seems like it has lasted a life time. I am having an ultrasound guided biopsy...Why did they tell me not to eat or drink?  I will be awake won't I?  I just want this over with.  I just have a bad feeling and I don't know why.  They did state in the ultrasound that both of the solid nodules are PROBABLY fibroademnomas.  I have it in my mind they just put that in there so I would not be concerned, especially with the past history of brain cancer.  I especially don't like that they put ill-defined areas of density.  My brain MRI had the same stinking words on it.  I'm so sorry I just need to vent for a few minutes.
